citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The facility's current program of veterinary care does not include birds, of which 14 individuals are kept at the facility. A
program of adequate veterinary care must be established by the facility and approved by the attending veterinarian to
ensure: the appropriateness of the facilities for the species kept, that appropriate methods are employed for the
prevention, control, diagnoses and treatment of disease, and that adequate guidance is provided to personnel involved in
the care and use of animals, among other items outlined in this section of the Act. The absence of a program of adequate
veterinary care and formal veterinary care for birds could lead to poor health and welfare outcomes for this group of
animals.
Correct by ensuring that the program of veterinary care includes all regulated animals at the facility, and that the attending
veterinarian is given adequate authority for their care by formal arrangement. Correct by November 15, 2023.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
The facility does not have an environmental enhancement plan for birds. An environmental enhancement plan must be
developed, documented, and approved by the attending veterinarian so as to promote the health and psychological well-
being of birds.
Correct by ensuring that a complete, documented plan for environmental enhancement that addresses the required
elements and is approved by the attending veterinarian, is maintained and available for inspection. Correct by November
30, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.40(b) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
The facility's current program of veterinary care does not include birds, of which 14 individuals are kept at the facility. A 
program of adequate veterinary care must be established by the facility and approved by the attending veterinarian to 
ensure: the appropriateness of the facilities for the species kept, that appropriate methods are employed for the 
prevention, control, diagnoses and treatment of disease, and that adequate guidance is provided to personnel involved in 
the care and use of animals, among other items outlined in this section of the Act. The absence of a program of adequate 
veterinary care and formal veterinary care for birds could lead to poor health and welfare outcomes for this group of 
animals.  
 
Correct by ensuring that the program of veterinary care includes all regulated animals at the facility, and that the attending 
veterinarian is given adequate authority for their care by formal arrangement. Correct by November 15, 2023. 
3.154 
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
The facility does not have an environmental enhancement plan for birds. An environmental enhancement plan must be 
developed, documented, and approved by the attending veterinarian so as to promote the health and psychological well-
being of birds.  
 
Correct by ensuring that a complete, documented plan for environmental enhancement that addresses the required 
elements and is approved by the attending veterinarian, is maintained and available for inspection. Correct by November 
30, 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
